No I'm not on any medicine. However, Lupus by itself can cause hair loss - it is an autoimmune disease meaning it turns against growing cells and tissue including hair. A lupus 'flare' (when all the symptoms occur) is believed to be triggered by an imbalance of hormones among other causes. Lupus.org has a ton of info. There are apparently several other symptoms including a rash across the cheeks especially in women (butterfly shape). Still, it could be several other things, you need to get tested to make sure (and so do I!).Why did your doctor say you have the 'start' of diabetes and high glucose levels? 70-90 is normal glucose level, even upto 110. I believe diabetes can also trigger some of these symptoms such as hair loss, frequent urination and excessive thirst, fatigue. Not sure about swollen feet and hands though.Also some minor condition in combination with stress can lead to a lot of symptoms. So don't worry yet. Again, only way to make sure is to get tested. I am getting tested next week for everything.

question: In june i woke up after 2 weeks of extreme stress with swollen hands and feet.  I had excessive thirst and urination.  I could barely walk or move due to pain.  I also noticed a light rash on my thighs and legs.  I went to my doctor who took blood for tests and was told after this that my glucose levels are elevated i have the start of diabetes and slightly anemic.  When the test were done he also told me they think i have fibromalagia.  After a week the pain got better and swelling went down.  But I seem to be more anxious during certain times.  I am not on any medication except ibuprofen or muscle relaxers as needed.  I get tired quickly and have muscle spasms at times but it doesnt stay very long.  The thing that bothers me the most is no one seems positive to what i have it seems a guess.  And I notice if i sit too long i get stiff hurt and swell.  So i keep moving.  I have been watching what i eat for 3 months lost only a few pounds.  And have extreme hair loss thining all over my head.  This is making me very upset my hair doesnt respond well to curling iron seems to be changing.  When i call the doctor they just say its stress. Please help is it all fibromalagia or should i push for the test to be done again, thyroid, lupus, lyme etc.  by the way my glucose levels never go higher than 100 they usually stay low 70 to 90.
